name: vodun
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a West African religion that involves the worship of the spirits of nature and of dead people. Its beliefs form part of the voodoo religion that is common in parts of the Caribbean, especially Haiti, and in parts of the southern United States: The western world has often promoted negative images of Vodun. Voodoo is a mix of West African Vodun and European Christianity. Compare
voodoo
More examplesFewer examplesThe word "voodoo" is a corruption of the word '"vodun" meaning "god" or "spirit" in the West African Fon language.Missionaries came to Africa to convert the young away from Vodun so that it was easier for the Europeans to colonize.Figures published by the Office of National Statistics show that spiritualism and paganism is thriving, and that beliefs range from vodun (voodoo) to the Native American Church.
